column4: have been having a number of troubles with ubuntu. I do like it I just cant depend on it it freezes alot and I have had to reinstall like 4 times, now my dvd/cd drives are not being read. I am fairly new to linux a former windows user I am very familiar with that os. I really dont know what to ask you accept if you know how I can fix these issues. Any help would be very much appreciated.
i need help making my cd/ dvd drives work again can anyone help?
not saying anyone can, but if you open a terminal, type tail -f /var/log/syslog , and then slip in a cd , you'll get a log you can show people
do that tail -f /var/log/syslog thing I mentioned; it'll get you the "useful info"
no output when you put in the cd?
you only have one plug coming from the computer to the wires, right?
hm, you might find some info on how to configure that on alsa-project.org
don't sweat it, I've been sudoing for years, and I still see that now and then ;)
wesnoth, alien-arena is a popular team shooter
try #kubuntu, they pay more attention to kde
there is nobody answering there either
